children.text: We are given three Java programs to be executed in sequence.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: The output of the first program becomes the input to the second, and the output of the second becomes the input to the third.
children.label: mental_execution

children.text:
However, note that the programs are independent and each was originally designed to read from stdin and write to stdout. We are to chain them without intermediate I/O.

Steps:
1. We must combine the three programs into a single Fortran program. 2. Only the first program (atcoder_ABC172_D) will read from stdin.

tree.original_reasoning:
We are given three Java programs to be executed in sequence. The output of the first program becomes the input to the second, and the output of the second becomes the input to the third.

However, note that the programs are independent and each was originally designed to read from stdin and write to stdout. We are to chain them without intermediate I/O.

Steps:
1. We must combine the three programs into a single Fortran program.
2. Only the first program (atcoder_ABC172_D) will read from stdin.
3. The output of the first program (a long integer) will be passed as input to the second program (atcoder_ABC170_A). But note: the second program expects an array of strings (space separated) and then it counts until it finds a "0". However, the first program outputs a single number. We must adapt the second program to work with the output of the first.

end program
